Coop's report finds cigarettes and other forms of tobacco are addictive the culprit is nicotine and keup says tobacco addiction is similar to heroin and cocaine addiction Coupe statements are expected to have a big impact on the public debate over smoking the surgeon general's report comes out once a year and is mandated by Congress Coop's 1986 report dealt with the dangers of secondhand smoke and led to numerous regulations against smoking in public places

laws restricting smoking in restaurants and the workplace are now common and last January mayor Koch signed a bill Banning were restricting smoking in virtually all public places in New York City the anti-smoking movement is growing only 27 percent of American adults currently smoke down from 42% just two decades ago

but in response to today's report the tobacco Institute says this report trivializes the serious drug problem faced by Society the claim that cigarette smoking is a drug addiction similar to cocaine or heroin use or alcohol abuse is unfortunate and unwarranted will be discussing the surgeon general's most recent report on smoking a little bit later on in this broadcast and will be joined live by a high-ranking official from the New Jersey Department of Health and the surgeon general's and
